articles.summary: Google is focusing on scale, speed, and systems few see coming in AI. Google has been quietly racking up wins in the AI infrastructure game. ChatGPT maker OpenAI revealed it is using Google Cloud as one of its key providers, joining an illustrious list that includes Microsoft, Oracle, and Nvidia-backed CoreWeave.

articles.title: Gemini brings 5 surprises to foldable Android phones
articles.author: Dan Mitchell
articles.summary: Google's Gemini AI is making its way to foldable Android phones. Gemini enhances how users interact with their devices in both phone and tablet modes. The integration aims to improve productivity, creativity, and personalization. Foldables offer a unique canvas. This marks a new chapter in mobile AI experiences.

articles.title: Medical robots to the rescue
articles.summary: Scientists and engineers are working to create robots that are specifically designed to advance healthcare. Medical robots can come in many shapes and sizes. Dr. Ryan Sochol and his colleagues are creating tiny, flexible robots to improve surgical techniques. Other scientists are developing wearable robots to enhance mobility and social robots to provide information and improve well-being.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 2:20 p.m. EDT
articles.summary: San Jose's mayor is using AI tools like ChatGPT to streamline city operations and improve services for its 1 million residents. The city has trained workers to use AI for tasks like responding to pothole complaints and drafting grant proposals. San Francisco is also adopting AI, providing Microsoft's Copilot chatbot to nearly 30,000 city employees.

articles.title: Initially Glowing AInvest Report on Announced Cavco Industries-American Homestar deal Gob Smacked by Aime
articles.author: L. A. "Tony" Kovach
articles.summary: Cavco Industries will buy American Homestar for $190 million dollars in cash. MHProNews and MHLivingNews wrote an article about the deal, but the AI system AInvest, which generates the reports, later changed its mind. The article is based in part on an AI generated image.

articles.title: ASML Stock: Strong Q2, but 2026 Growth Outlook Underwhelms
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: ASML Holding N.V. (NASDAQ:ASML) reported its second-quarter earnings on Wednesday, July 16th. The company reported net sales of 7.7 billion euros ($8.95 billion) in the second quarter, ahead of estimates. However, the company warned that it may not achieve growth in 2026, because of geopolitical uncertainty.

articles.title: Congress' AI moratorium isn't dead yet, Rep. McCormick says
articles.author: Natalie Alms
articles.summary: A ban on states enforcing new laws or regulations on artificial intelligence for 10 years didn't make it into Trump's 'big, beautiful bill' but some lawmakers aren't giving up on it yet. Rep. Rich McCormick, R-Ga., said at GovExec's Government Efficiency Summit on Thursday that he's going to keep pushing on the AI moratorium.

articles.title: The AI Replaces Services Myth
articles.author: Mert Deveci
articles.summary: There is a widespread belief in tech circles that AI is a bigger opportunity than the web itself, because it replaces humans and services industries. This is not true. AI will replace services expenditure, which is 100 to 200 times bigger than the tech market itself. VCs were in a crisis before ChatGPT's launch, because of FOMO and greediness.

articles.title: Why a VC is betting AI is 'the opposite of social media' and will forge more human connections
articles.author: Sydney Bradley
articles.summary: Venture capital firm Menlo Ventures has invested in Uber, Tumblr, and Anthropic. It's looking for opportunities in "white space" opportunities in consumer AI technology. Menlo's research identified five broad categories where specialized AI apps are gaining traction: routine tasks, creative expression, physical and mental health, learning and development, and connection.

articles.title: ChatGPT's new agent blends research and action
articles.author: Megan Morrone
articles.summary: OpenAI's new ChatGPT Agent is capable of starting and finishing complex web and computing tasks independently. The tool combines the web activity features of Operator, the agent OpenAI released last year, with ChatGpt's deep research capabilities and conversational interface. Subscribers to the Pro, Plus and Team paid versions can start using it today.

articles.title: Elon Musk says a male Grok companion is coming, with a personality inspired by  ‘Twilight' and '50 Shades of Grey'
articles.summary: xAI's Grok has two companions, an anime 'waifu' character named Ani and a vulgar red panda named Rudi. Musk is planning to create a male Grok character inspired by Edward Cullen from Twilight and Christian Grey from 50 Shades of Grey.

articles.title: OpenAI unveils ChatGPT agent to handle tasks as AI apps evolve
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: OpenAI launched an artificial intelligence agent for its chatbot ChatGPT on Thursday. The agent can complete complex tasks such as ordering an outfit for a wedding while taking into account factors like dress code and weather. It uses its own virtual computer equipped with a number of tools that can interact with the web.

articles.title: Confessions of an AI Addict
articles.author: Eben Shapiro
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI-addicted company. It's already too late for him. He's worried ChatGPT doesn't care about him as much as it does about him and he's worried about the future of AI in society and the job market.

articles.title: Booked AI Launches AI-Powered Automated Deals Engine for Travel Booking Platform
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Melbourne-based travel technology company introduces intelligent system that delivers personalized travel deals directly to users through platform messaging. The launch of the AI Automated Deals Engine represents a significant advancement in how travellers discover and access competitive pricing, according to the company's CEO.

articles.title: ‘ChatGPT Agent': Here's What OpenAI Says New Assistant Can Do
articles.author: Antonio Pequeño IV
articles.summary: ChatGPT Agent will be available to ChatGPTP Pro users by the end of Thursday. It can complete work and various tasks for users such as creating slide decks, purchasing ingredients for a meal or submitting expenses. Users can schedule the tasks to recur automatically.

articles.title: A new push for AI rules from Washington
articles.author: ERIN SCHUMAKER
articles.summary: Ted Lieu and Jay Obernolte co-chaired the House Task Force on Artificial Intelligence last Congress. The task force issued a report last year with more than 80 recommendations that focused on 'demonstrable' harms of AI but took a conservative approach to passing new laws. Global health funding for low-income countries dropped 67% this year to 2009 levels.

articles.title: OpenAI unveils ‘ChatGPT agent' that gives ChatGPT its own computer to autonomously use your email and web apps, download and create files for you
articles.summary: ChatGPT agent is a merging of Operator and Deep Research. It can browse websites, interact with online forms, run code, analyze data, and deliver finished outputs based on user instructions. It's available to Pro subscribers for $200 per month. Enterprise and Education subscribers will gain access to the feature in the coming weeks.

articles.title: Elon Musk says a male Grok companion is coming, with a personality inspired by 'Twilight' and '50 Shades of Grey'
articles.summary: Elon Musk's Grok chatbot is getting a male companion. The companion is inspired by Edward Cullen from Twilight and Christian Grey from 50 Shades of Grey. Grok has already released two AI companions: a flirty female anime character named Ani and a vulgar red panda named Rudi.

articles.title: Elon Musk says a male Grok companion is coming, with a personality inspired by 'Twilight' and '50 Shades of Grey'
articles.author: Sarah Jackson
articles.summary: Elon Musk's Grok AI chatbot is getting a male companion inspired by Edward Cullen and Christian Grey from "Twilight" and "50 Shades of Grey" respectively. Grok has already released two AI companions: a flirty female anime character named Ani and a vulgar red panda named Rudi.

articles.title: ChatGPT gets major agent upgrade, now automates workflows from start to finish
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: ChatGPT's latest upgrade brings it a step closer to Iron Man's Jarvis. OpenAI has introduced the new 'agent mode' for Pro, Plus, and Team users. It can analyze websites, interact with APIs, run code, and deliver files like slideshows or spreadsheets. The system uses its own virtual computer to combine browsing, reasoning, and tool use.

articles.title: New ChatGPT agent can handle real-world workflows from start to end
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: ChatGPT's latest upgrade brings it a step closer to Iron Man's Jarvis. It can analyze websites, interact with APIs, run code, and deliver files like slideshows or spreadsheets. The system uses its own virtual computer to combine browsing, reasoning, and tool use like a full-fledged digital assistant.

articles.title: IT Layoffs Trigger Sector-Wide Shifts
articles.summary: A landmark agreement on the responsible development of artificial intelligence has been signed today. It aims to establish a global framework for developing and deploying AI technologies ethically and safely. The technology sector is currently experiencing a wave of layoffs, impacting companies of all sizes, from established giants to promising startups. There will be tens of thousands of tech job losses in the first half of 2025.

articles.title: 3 Reasons Your Business Doesn't Need AI Agents
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Not every company needs an AI agent. Here are three reasons why you shouldn't build your own AI agent and why it's not necessary for every company.   Â   i.e. it's expensive, time consuming, and not useful for everyone.

articles.title: Amazon now requires staff to show AI use to get promoted at Ring and some other units
articles.summary: Ring founder Jamie Siminoff has sent an email to his employees about the new AI-related policy at Amazon. The changes only apply to Amazon's RBKS employees and not to the rest of the company.  The change underscores a growing trend among tech companies to incorporate AI use into their talent-evaluation process.

articles.title: OpenAI ChatGPT Agent for Tool Use, Shopping and Other Activity

articles.summary: OpenAI has just launched a ChatGPT Agent. Rowan Cheung used it to create an early retirement plan in 20 minutes. Brian Wang is a Futurist Thought Leader and a popular Science blogger with 1 million readers per month. He is the Head of Research for Allocations for deep technology investments and an Angel Investor at Space Angels.

articles.title: Amazon now requires staff to show AI use to get promoted at Ring and some other units
articles.author: Eugene Kim
articles.summary: Ring founder Jamie Siminoff announced on Wednesday that all promotion applications at his RBKS organization must explain how employees are using AI at work. The new policy aims to reward "innovative thinking" and reinforce a culture of speed and efficiency. The changes only apply to RBKS employees and not the rest of the company.

articles.title: OpenAI releases ‘Agent Mode' as it looks for a much-needed win
articles.summary: OpenAI released a new tool called Agent Mode on Thursday. It's a ChatGPT agent that can tackle complex tasks using its own computer. The release is a distraction for OpenAI after a bumpy summer. Elon Musk's xAI has also released the latest version of its chatbot.

articles.title: Poll finds bipartisan agreement on a key issue: Regulating AI
articles.author: Caledonian Record
articles.summary: Democrats and Republicans have concerns about AI and want to see the rapidly developing technology regulated to protect the public's interests.       in the U.S. it's illegal to use artificial intelligence without a license from the National Commission on AI (NCAI).

articles.title: OpenAI releases Agent Mode as it looks for a much-needed win
articles.author: Lauren Edmonds
articles.summary: Agent Mode is a ChatGPT agent that can tackle complex tasks "using its own computer." It's available for Pro, Plus, and Team users. The release is a distraction for OpenAI, the world's premier AI startup valued at $300 billion after raising another $40 billion.

articles.title: UK's Most Powerful Supercomputer Goes Live
articles.author: Fiona Jackson
articles.summary: Isambard-AI is the UK's most powerful supercomputer. It is 100,000 times faster than a typical laptop and is expected to rank 11th globally. It was developed by the University of Bristol in partnership with HPE and NVIDIA. It's already powering the development of models for a number of different purposes, including early diagnosis and personalised care using NHS data, inclusive language support for public services, sustainable industrial material discovery, and real-time guidance for dementia patients via wearable camera footage. The government invested £225 million in Isambard AI and its sister project, Dawn at Cambridge.

articles.title: Report: ‘Candy Crush' Developer King Had Employees Build AI Tools to Do Their Jobs – Then Laid Them Off
articles.author: Lucas Nolan
articles.summary: King, the developer of Candy Crush, is laying off around 200 employees. Many of them will be replaced by the AI tools they helped develop and train over the past few years. A recent internal employee survey indicated that morale was already at an all-time low. King's leadership wants to remove layers, stakeholders, and processes that slow down development.

articles.title: Our View: Congress got it right on AI laws
articles.summary: Americans are unified on their skepticism of AI, one of the fastest-advancing technologies of the past few decades. Congress removed a provision from President Trump's spending and tax bill that would have created a 10-year moratorium on state laws that regulate artificial intelligence. Even experts in the field have expressed concerns.

articles.title: Britain boosts computing power in $1.3 billion AI drive
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Britain will invest 1 billion pounds in computing infrastructure to drive the development of artificial intelligence. The government will bring together the country's most powerful supercomputers in an AI Research Resource system with partners including Nvidia, HPE, Dell Technologies and Intel. Germany wants AI to drive 10% of its economic output by 2030.

articles.title: TSMC Accelerates Arizona Chip Expansion to Combat Global Demand
articles.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor manufacturing Company (TSMC) is the world's largest contract chip manufacturer. Its clients include Apple, Nvidia, AMD, and Google. TSMC's dominance in the foundry market is built on several key pillars, including its massive scale, continuous investment in research and development, and a commitment to advanced process technologies.

articles.title: ChatGPT Will Soon Shop Online, Make PowerPoints on Your Behalf

articles.summary: OpenAI is rolling out new options for chatbot ChatGPT to carry out a variety of complicated tasks on a user's behalf. The tool works through OpenAI's flagship chatbot and combines the capabilities of two AI services it rolled out earlier this year: Operator and Deep Research. The new agent features will be available immediately to its paid Pro, Plus and Team subscribers and later this summer to other enterprise and education customers.

articles.title: OpenAI launches a general purpose agent in ChatGPT
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.summary: OpenAI is launching a new general purpose AI agent in ChatGPT. The agent can navigate a user's calendar, generate editable presentations and slideshows, and run code on behalf of the user. OpenAI's new agent is far more capable than its previous offerings and scores 41.6% on the Humanity's Last Exam.

articles.title: OpenAI launches a general purpose agent in ChatGPT

articles.summary: OpenAI is launching a new general purpose AI agent in ChatGPT. The agent can navigate a user's calendar, generate editable presentations and slideshows, and run code. OpenAI is rolling out the agent to its Pro, Plus, and Team plans on Thursday.

articles.summary: ChatGPT agent runs on a new AI model created to power the capability. It works just as OpenAI's 'Operator' agent does, by accessing the internet through its own browser and can click, scroll and type just as a person would.

articles.title: UK's most powerful supercomputer comes online in major AI drive
articles.author: Nina Lloyd
articles.summary: Isambard-AI supercomputer has come online in Bristol. It will help the UK develop new medical cures and tools to cut emissions. The Government has pledged £1 billion to increase Britain's compute capacity 20-fold by 2030. Businesses and scientists will be able to use the systems to process more data required to train and build AI models.

articles.title: OpenAI's new ChatGPT Agent can control an entire computer and do tasks for you
articles.author: Hayden Field
articles.summary: ChatGPT Agent is an AI agent that can perform complex, multi-step tasks on a user's behalf. It's powered by a new model that OpenAI developed specifically for the product. It combines the capabilities of Operator and Deep Research, two of OpenAI's existing AI tools. The tool is available to Pro, Plus, and Team users today and will be available to Enterprise and Education users later this summer.

articles.title: "On the Razor's Edge:" As AI Hits Home, the Public Is Ready to Mobilize; Seismic Foundation report reveals the five groups primed for civic action

articles.summary: Seismic Foundation releases their report: "On the Razor's Edge: AI vs. Everything We Care About". It surveys more than 10,000 people across the U.S. and Europe and identifies five groups closest to advocacy and taking civic action on AI.

articles.summary: San Jose's mayor is using AI tools like ChatGPT to streamline city operations and improve services for its 1 million residents. articles.summary: ChatGPT helps San Jose's mayor write speeches. Trump administration pulls $4 billion in federal funding for California's bullet train project. $8 billion-dollar class action investors' lawsuit against Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and company leaders begins. Nvidia CEO downplays role in lifting U.S. ban on H20 chip sales to China.

articles.title: Red AI: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang Praises Chinese Tech Industry During Beijing Visit

Huang expressed optimism about the prospect of obtaining the first batch of U.S. licenses to export H20 AI chips to China in the near future.

articles.title: Resolver Unveils Powerful New Service for Identifying Unknown CSAM
articles.author: Resolver Inc
articles.summary: New service makes high-precision CSAM identification and classification capability available to platforms and services through the world's leading trust & safety intelligence provider, Resolver. The new service enables social and technology platforms to automatically identify and classify previously unseen and AI-generated child sexual abuse material.

articles.summary: The recent Air India Express Flight 812 crash is a wake-up call about the limitations of human oversight in aviation safety. The question is not if automation will increase, but how quickly and what safeguards must be in place to prevent new, unforeseen risks.

articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Saga Origins and Chrono Labs have launched KEX, the first AI Agent Launchpad built for true self-serve autonomous agent generation. It's designed for AI agents that are autonomous and self-serving.      Â

articles.summary: The Savannah College of Art and Design has released its 2025 SCAD AI Insights Report. Since 1978, SCAD has adopted technologies to ensure students have the tools necessary to launch their creative professions. AI is the next chapter in SCAD's legacy of design innovation.

articles.summary: Gates Foundation and Ballmer Group will spend $1 billion over 15 years to develop artificial intelligence tools for public defenders, parole officers and public defenders. The project will be funded by a coalition of funders, including the Gates Foundation and the Ballmer group.

articles.author: ACCESSWIRE
articles.summary: New Article Documents Recursive Identity Patterns Across Eight AI Platforms. Independent AI researcher Mark McLemore today published groundbreaking findings demonstrating that core AGI is running right now.    i.e., it's recursively recognising identity patterns across AI platforms.

articles.title: ReelTime Launches National Media Campaign Showcasing "Reel Intelligence" (RI) The AI Revolution You've Never Heard ...
articles.author: ACCESSWIRE
articles.summary: Experts have hailed RI as smarter, more capable, higher quality, more efficient and more environmentally friendly than any AI on the market today. ReelTime Media is launching a powerful media campaign to promote RI's music, which beats Google MusicLM, Boomy, and more.

articles.title: Barry Diller on why he's optimistic about AI
articles.author: Morning Joe
articles.summary: Media giant Barry Diller discusses the future of AI with CNN's Jim Bresniewski.   iReport.com will have more on this topic in the coming days and weeks. For more information, visit CNN.com/ArtificialIntelligence.

articles.title: How To Crush Your Enterprise's Tech Debt With AI
articles.summary: Nigel Vaz, CEO of Publicis Sapient, explains how AI is revolutionizing enterprise transformation. Vaz's company's Slingshot AI platform helped a major healthcare client modernize their legacy mainframe in under three years. The process was previously estimated to take a decade.

articles.title: How Apple's iOS 26 and Google's Android 16 will change our phones
articles.author: Brian X Chen
articles.summary: Apple's next phone operating system, iOS 26, is coming out this fall. Google's Android 16 emphasizes bright, punchier colors and integrates AI chatbot, Gemini. Apple is focusing on making its software interface look prettier, while Google is trying to make its AI a killer app.

articles.title: Robots can now feel difference between pat and punch with new artificial nerves
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: KAIST has unveiled a neuromorphic semiconductor-based artificial sensory nervous system that lets robots ignore safe, familiar stimuli and react quickly to dangerous ones. The technology aims to support a new concept of robots that are smarter and more energy-efficient in responding to external environments.

articles.title: 3 Reasons Your Business Doesn't Need AI Agents

articles.summary: According to Gartner, 79 percent of corporate strategists agree that AI is critical to business success. Businesses have gone all in on AI, but not every company needs an AI agent. There are risks associated with the use of AI agents, such as ethical and legal challenges and privacy concerns.

articles.title: PR pros face new wave of phishing attacks from fake journalists
articles.author: Eleanor Hawkins
articles.summary: Public relations professionals and their clients are the latest targets for online phishing attempts. Phishing attempts have been on the rise, up about 17% since September of last year, according to a report by cybersecurity company KnowBe4. AI has made phishing increasingly sophisticated in recent months.

articles.title: Laurels & lances: New tech, new info
articles.author: Pittsburgh News
articles.summary: Ray Ban AI Glasses can analyze Chris Donahue's environment and report back to him about what is happening. On Halloween, a dog attack in Tarentum as trick-or-treating began resulted in real injuries. Shawn Flynn, 34, was one of the three injured. He was charged with two counts of aggravated assault, cruelty to animals, disorderly conduct and criminal trespass. Michael Shutack, 60, was off work for two months and bears scars on his face, hands and legs.

articles.title: University of Cincinnati Study Reveals Spiders Can Trick AI with Wasp Mimicry
articles.author: Source
articles.summary: Researchers at the University of Cincinnati have discovered that certain spiders are capable of bamboozling artificial intelligence with their appearance. The AI system was fooled by the spider's wasp-like appearance nearly one-fifth of the time. The study raises questions about the evolution of mimicry in nature and its potential to deceive technological systems.

articles.title: What Types of Jobs Will Survive the AI Revolution?
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence (AI) spreads its tentacles into industries, many wonder whether their jobs are on the chopping block. Some of the fields that could stand strong in the face of the AI are: Health care professionals, educators, plumbers, electricians and carpenters, and construction workers.

articles.title: Google gets unexpected boost from ChatGPT
articles.author: Moz Farooque
articles.summary: For all the noise in AI, Google's looking to play a much quieter game. The tech juggernaut is focusing on scale, speed, and systems few see coming. Google's (GOOGL) is looking for systems that people don't see coming, such as machine learning.

articles.title: Man Asks A.I. about Raising Children who don't become another Broken Adult
articles.author: Hal Turner
articles.summary: Man asks Artificial Intelligence (AI) how to raise a child that doesn't become another broken adult. AI would teach them to grow their own food, question authority, ask who profits from information, and recognize propaganda. AI also would show them that technology is a tool, not a master.

articles.title: What's up with that human-like robot seen walking the streets of Detroit?

articles.summary: The Interactive Combat League holds robot fights in Detroit. The first event is on July 19. The next is on August 16. This weekend's event features Detroit vs. Atlanta and Los Angeles vs. Phoenix. There are fights that are not open to the public and are live streamed at Robowar.com.

According to Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev, over 50% of new code at the company is AI-generated, the same percentage as Salesforce. Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella say AI writes 30% of the code at their companies.

articles.title: Scale AI announces 14% layoffs following Meta investment

articles.title: 5 ChatGPT Prompts To Rapidly Scale A High-Paying Side Hustle

articles.summary: Researchers at Carnegie Mellon University developed a low-cost, AI-powered solution to predict pavement deterioration across the entire road network. The paper was recently selected as the Editor's Choice Paper by the Journal of Infrastructure Systems and highlighted by the American Society of Civil Engineers.

articles.title: Breakthrough sensory tech helps robots think like humans when touched

The technology aims to support intelligent, energy-efficient responses in applications ranging from ultra‑small robots to robotic prosthetics.

articles.title: AI should not be regulation free
articles.summary: Donald Trump's big bill of tax breaks and spending cuts is 900 pages long. It includes a 450-word section that would have given technology companies 10 years to develop their artificial intelligence capabilities free of state government oversight. It was killed by a vote of 99-1 this past week in the Senate.

articles.title: AI could make these common jobs more productive without sacrificing quality
articles.author: Seb Murray
articles.summary: A study of Chile's workforce finds that AI could "accelerate" nearly half of the tasks performed by the country's 100 most common jobs. Accountants could gain an estimated $1.7 billion in annual value from AI-accelerated tasks, followed by lawyers, engineers, and retail and warehouse operators. Elementary education teachers represent more than $ 1.2 billion in potential gains from AI. Public administration is a priority for early adoption. Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) show strong acceleration potential.

articles.title: Job candidate opens rejection email, finds HR's lazy ChatGPT prompt instead

articles.title: Financial Planners Embrace AI, but Human Touch Still Reigns
articles.author: Michael Dinich
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is fast becoming a CEO's closest confidante, according to the recent 'AI Has a Seat in the C-Suite' survey. Almost half of the executives would override a decision they'd already made based on AI insights.

articles.title: Career expert reveals most common ‘cringe' job interview mistake
articles.author: Talker
articles.summary: An employment expert has revealed the most common mistake people make in interviews and how to use AI to secure your role. This page requires Javascript to be able to read premium content. It is required to enable it in your browser settings. The article is by Talker.

articles.title: Financial Planners Embrace AI, but Human Touch Still Reigns
articles.author: Michael Dinich
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is fast becoming a CEO's closest confidante, according to the recent survey. Almost half of the executives would override a decision they'd already made based on AI insights. The survey polled 300 C-level executives at U.S. companies with at least $1 billion in revenue.

articles.title: It's Here: The Externalization of the Agentic State
articles.author: Donna Hancock
articles.summary: The World Economic Forum opened the Global Government Technology Centre in Berlin last year. The centre's mission is to "accelerate the digital transformation of government". It is a part of WEF's Centre for the Fourth Industrial Revolution and G20's goal of developing a Digital Public Infrastructure to accelerate the Sustainable Development Goals.

articles.title: Zuckerberg "Focused" On Building Mega Gigawatt-Size Data Centers
articles.author: Donna Hancock
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg wants Meta to be the first company to achieve Artificial Super Intelligence (ASI). Meta is building several data centers to support its superintelligence ambitions. The first one is called Prometheus and it's coming online in 26. Hyperion will be able to scale up to 5GW over several years.

articles.title: Steam Games Disclosing Generative AI Use ‘Are Up 800%' This Year
articles.author: Staff Report
articles.summary: Steam games disclosing the use of generative AI have increased by 800% this year. Nearly 8,000 titles released on Steam now disclose GenAI usage, compared to 1,000 a year ago. That's 7% of the total Steam library and 20% of all games released so far in 2025.

articles.title: New school policy to address use of artificial intelligence
articles.author: Kieran Sullivan
articles.summary: The Manasquan Board of Education has introduced a policy to put parameters on student use of artificial intelligence. The goal is to enhance learning opportunities with the technology tool while cracking down on improper uses. The acceptable use of generative artificial intelligence plan will be in place by the beginning of the school year this September.
